The Mistband - wrist cuff door opener | Samnang Nuonsinoeun

The Mistband - wrist cuff door opener

December 02, 2024

Focus Areas

Industrial Design Product Development Rapid Prototyping Computer Aided Design Sketching 3D Printing

My Role

I conducted client interviews to identify specific needs and pain points. Designed and prototyped the Mistband using CAD software and rapid prototyping techniques. Performed user testing and incorporated feedback into iterative design improvements. Produced a durable, adjustable, and user-friendly final product using 3D printing technology.

Impact

I empowered a client with C5-C6 complete quadriplegia, to independently open pull-doors with lever handles, significantly improving her autonomy in daily life. Delivered a compact, portable, and comfortable solution that seamlessly integrates into the client’s everyday routine.

Problem

Our client has C5-C6 complete quadriplegia, which limits her finger mobility and arm strength. They struggle to open pull-doors with lever handles, a challenge compounded by the need to operate a motorized wheelchair joystick with the right hand.

Solution

The Mistband, a wristband with an attached loop, enables our client to independently open pull-doors by wrapping the loop around the handle, pushing down, and pulling back.

Key features of the Mistband include:

Innovative Clip Mechanism

  • Allows for quick and easy adjustment
  • Provides a secure fit without the need for holes or a buckle

Safety

  • Durable 3D-printed core with smooth edges.

Comfort

  • Closed-cell foam lining prevents irritation and resists dirt.

Portability

  • Compact enough to attach to a wheelchair, store in a purse, or wear on the wrist.

Adjustability

  • Dual fastening mechanisms ensure a snug fit for secure usage.

Final Product
